thread.title: England's collapse in Bangalore examined | Cricket | Sporting News
thread.title_full: England's collapse in Bangalore examined | Cricket | Sporting News

author: Matthew Scott
title: England's collapse in Bangalore examined | Cricket | Sporting News
text:
February 1, 2017 3:13pm EST February 1, 2017 3:13pm EST England turned in one of the great (or should that be terrible?) batting collapses to hand India the T20I series. Yuzvendra Chahal celebrates taking a wicket against England in Bangalore (Twitter @ICC) Matthew Scott 
Published on Feb. 1, 2017 
Feb. 1, 2017 
The Test and ODI series against India were marred for England by collapses, but they went the whole hog in losing the T20I decider in Bangalore on Wednesday. 
MORE: Selector takes swipe at White | Johnson calls out selectors 
Eoin Morgan (40) and Joe Root (42) had the tourists ahead of the rate as they chased 202, but they fell in successive deliveries to spark the mother of all collapses. Yuzvendra Chahal returned the best T20I figures by an Indian (6-25) with Jasprit Bumrah (3-14) his able sidekick as England were skittled for 127 in 16.3 overs. 
We've given you a few ways to digest the incredible information. So sit back, relax, and marvel at the utter incompetence of Morgan's men, picking up the action midway through the 13th over... A six-wicket haul for @yuzi_chahal ! The first 5+ wicket haul for India in T20Is! Stunning performance! #IndvEng pic.twitter.com/KikWZft2yl 
Nineteen balls. Eight runs. Eight wickets. 
W W . . . W 1 1 1 1 W . 4 W . W W . W 
13.3: Chahal to Morgan. OUT 13.4: Chahal to Root. OUT 13.5: Chahal to Stokes. No run 13.6: Chahal to Stokes. No run 
14.1: Bumrah to Buttler. No run 14.2: Bumrah to Buttler. OUT 14.3: Bumrah to Stokes. One run 14.4: Bumrah to Moeen. One run 14.5: Bumrah to Stokes. One run 14.6: Bumrah to Moeen. One run 
15.1: Chahal to Moeen. OUT 15.2: Chahal to Stokes. No run 15.3: Chahal to Stokes. Four runs 15.4: Chahal to Stokes. OUT 15.5: Chahal to Jordan. No run 15.6: Chahal to Jordan. OUT 
16.1: Bumrah to Plunkett. OUT 16.2: Bumrah to Mills. No run 16.3: Bumrah to Mills. OUT And it is a wrap! Test series 4-0, ODI and T20I series 2-1 #INDvENG #TeamIndia @Paytm pic.twitter.com/IX9u2vheCk
